properties.Project Description: World leading energy research scheme, involving collaborations with industry and research organisations in Wales, Europe and worldwide. The scheme investigates how multiple energy sources can be supplied to consumers through more flexible and efficient systems that integrate traditional and renewable energy sources
CUBRIC II is the relocation, expansion and development of the existing Cardiff University Brain Research Imaging Centre thus enabling an increase in its world class research capacity and facilities.
properties.Project Title: Cardiff University Brain Research Imaging Centre  II (CUBRIC II)

properties.Project Description: Pioneering cutting edge research within Welsh universities using supercomputing facilities on a scale not currently available to deliver world class expertise to boost the Welsh economy.

Build, equip and run a state-of-the-art cleanroom at the new Institute for Compound Semiconductors (ICS) along with skilled personnel to deliver the research support for the development of new products, processes and services.

Bringing together expertise from across Welsh universities in collaboration with manufacturing companies to support the development and adoption of advanced technologies, increasing growth in the Welsh manufacturing sector.
Construction of a world class centre for computer science research, establishing Wales as a global destination for computer scientists and industrial partners.

World leading energy research scheme, involving collaborations with industry and research organisations in Wales, Europe and worldwide. The scheme investigates how multiple energy sources can be supplied to consumers through more flexible and efficient systems that integrate traditional and renewable energy sources.

Construction  of Menai Science Park (MSparc) creating highly skilled long-term employment opportunities for local people, developing a knowledge-sharing environment and creating an economic hub in sectors such as low carbon, energy and environment and ICT.
A new building on the Swansea Bay Campus which provides an innovative materials, processing and numerical technologies research base
Helping small and medium sized enterprises (SMEs) to design and test new mobile and emerging technologies to create products and services for commercial success.
properties.Project Title: CEMET Centre of Excellence in Mobile and Emerging Technology WWV

properties.Project Description:
Helps Welsh businesses develop new ways of converting feedstocks, such as rye grass, oats and miscanthus (Asian elephant grass) amongst others, and waste streams into products which have applications in the pharmaceutical, chemicals, fuel and cosmetic industries.

Using the concept of “Bio refining” (the process of transforming plants into products via physical, chemical and biological techniques) to add value to Welsh natural resources. By undertaking collaborative research and development with business BEACON + translates academic knowledge into product innovation.

By undertaking collaborative research and development with business BEACON + translates academic knowledge into product innovation.
Collaborative research and development between universities and industry to grow Wales’ marine science sector and supporting the low carbon economy.
Developing and delivering the first examples of buildings as power stations which are able to generate, store and release their own energy both thermal and electrical.

Bringing together academics, clinicians and businesses to pioneer research into cutting-edge technologies, new products, processes and services.

properties.Project Description: A five-year research programme at Welsh universities aimed at addressing the key challenges of developing next generation solar photovoltaic technology
properties.Project Title: Solar Photovoltaic Academic Research Consortium (SPARC II)

properties.Project Description: Aquaculture remains under developed in Wales, yet the aspiration is to make it a key economic sector, particularly for rural communities. Given the scarcity of mainstream sites, and the saturated food market, we propose to target non-food aquaculture, including cleaner fish production, fish for medical research, and algal-based aquafeeds and nutraceuticals.
To establish a world leading facility, developing new biotechnologies for the chemical and advanced materials industries by exploiting biomolecules from extreme environments.

RICE will combine established expertise, in algae conversion and hydrogen generation, with emerging expertise in heat-to-electricity, CO2 capture, and chemical waste, and their conversion to high value added products, in order to create new enterprises that can be integrated into present energy intensive industries to reduce CO2 emissions
A new veterinary facility at Aberystwyth, consisting of a fully-equipped, high-specification laboratory and office spaces to drive forward research to protect animal and human health.
